newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine government denies resignation rumours.
newsitem.headline: Argentine government denies resignation rumours.

text.p: The Argentine government denied market-moving rumors Tuesday that a cabinet minister was set to resign.
"It's totally false," a presidential spokesman told Reuters. "There is no movement. There will be no resignations."

The market rumors centered on Interior Minister Carlos Corach, Justice Minister Elias Jassan and presidential chief of staff Alberto Kohan, all named by former Economy Minister Domingo Cavallo in corruption allegations over the past week.
All three have denied the allegations.
Argentine Brady bonds in New York fell on the rumors, traders said.
